title: Here's an Idea for new low level players!
body: Maybe when you reach level 5, 10, 15 etc. you get a free champion of your choice? its hard to grind for rune pages champs and when your lv 30 you still dont have most of what you need.

replies.body: I think that would be beneficial for everyone, I also think riot should add in a feature where players can rent a champ for x amount of IP (not a lot im think of like 10% of the actual price) for maybe 3-5 games just to allow players to get a feel before they purchase an in-particular champion
3 things, you cant use in ranked, and you can only rent once (reworks reset this), and you cant earn key frags/chests
I agree, maybe not key fragments but yes to the other things
yeah i totally agree!
IDK Why but for some reason i always hated the renting system in all games.

I mean, you can always just spend real money for RP and buy champions and/or rune pages. Don't destroy me in the replies, Riot is a company and needs to make money, and this is probably a good way to make some. Level 30 players do not have enough champions to get into ranked gameplay, so they probably spend some money on it.

If you want to go money-free, then just grind through some more games. Game is completely free to play after all, no one forces you to pay anything, but at the same time, Riot needs to make money, and I believe that this is a good way.
Riot makes enough money on skins, and giving access to more champions would encourage bigger champion pools and thus raise the demand for skins.
Tbh you really only need 2 rune pages, but having more champs is nice.

Until you decide to diversify.  Not everyone is only AD or only AP.  Minimum I'd say is 4, AD, AP, HP, and either split AD/AP or Support (Gold quints and CDR).  If you've only got 2 rune pages, you're pretty severely limiting yourself unless you specialize in only one role.

I have 3 pages on AP alone with various levels of CDR in them.

I really do need all of them too because (for example) I don't buy Zhonya's in every game, and that changes how much CDR is in my build which must then be adjusted to with runes.

I have AD, AP, Hybrid + AS and Mpen singed.

This helps me in most situations even though they often aren't optimized for the champ. however ad and ap have gotten me through alot early on.

You don't only really need 2 rune pages. There are so many things you can create with rune pages. Every champion can be able with multiple rune set depending on the position, playstyle, opponent etc. 
Don't be one of those players who own every champion and only have 2 rune pages and can't get out of bronze because their runes are suboptimal. YES, runes DO decide the outcome of a game pretty often. If you can have designated rune pages for every single match-up you can face in the mid lane for example, then you can win this lane more often than not, thus winning the game more often than not.

How hard is it for low levels to buy the 450 ip ones? Then there's also the free ones you get for following Riot on social media.

I have had the wonderful experience of getting thirteen of my thirty-one Champions for free, so I'm not really unhappy with my experience of getting Champions. I also participated in a few party IP events where I got ridiculous amounts of IP that I spent on Champions and Runes.

Out of those thirteen, I got four during my pre-thirty levels, and with them and the Champions I bought with IP, I was able to cover all lanes quite well. I started saving my IP around level fifteen for Runes, and when I hit level twenty, I was almost able to buy a full page of Runes (for the level I was at). My IP income was also faster than the rate I was leveling up, so I was gradually able to fill up the last slots of my first page and start on the second. By level twenty-eight, both pages were full, and I was able to get a new Rune for each page the instant I leveled up. I had seven champions when I hit level thirty and two full Rune Pages. I think the IP income experience for new players is fine.
---
Order of champions:

Lissandra - My friend recommended her when I listed out the initial free champions, said she was a top tier mid - Got around level 11
Vi - I wanted a jungler because according to my friend "No one can jungle pre-thirty, so if you can jungle then you'll be set," and since my friend played her in the matches we were in, I wanted her - Got around level 14
Sona - I wanted a support since "Most people don't know how to support pre-twenty either, so if you can support you'll be all set," and she was the most fun out of all the supports I played when free (Soraka, Sona, Lux, Lulu, Nami) - Got around level 15
Quinn - Got as part of the free Champion giveaway from Pool Party 2015 - Got around level 24
Garen - Got as part of Twitter Promotion (decided to make a fake Twitter too since I was making a fake Facebook) - Got around level 24
Tristana - Got as part of Facebook promotion (decided that since I was making an account to take advantage of Quinn, why not also get Tristana) - Got around level 24
Alistar - Got as part of Youtube promotion (decided that since I was taking advantage of the other two free Champions I might as well take advantage of free Alistar) - Got around level 26
